Buffer Overflow.description: A buffer overflow occurs when a program writes more data to a buffer than it can hold.
recommendations: Use functions like strncpy() instead of strcpy() to prevent overflows.
Enable compiler protections like Stack Canaries and Address Sanitizer (ASAN).
Perform bounds checking on all inputs.
Adopt secure coding practices and use memory-safe languages like Rust.

Trapdoor.description: A trapdoor is a hidden mechanism that bypasses normal authentication or security checks.
recommendations: Regularly audit system logs for suspicious commands or unauthorized privilege escalations.
Restrict access to critical system files and enforce the principle of least privilege.
Use intrusion detection systems (IDS) to monitor unusual behavior.
Update and patch software regularly to close known backdoors.

Cache Poisoning.description: Cache poisoning manipulates cache data (e.g., ARP or DNS) to redirect traffic or disrupt communications.
recommendations: Enable ARP inspection and filtering on network devices.
Use secure DNS protocols such as DNSSEC.
Regularly clear and validate cache entries.
Monitor network traffic for duplicate IPs or unsolicited ARP replies.
